channel.title: ITUnderground events
channel.description: Events for the hacking organisation at the IT University of Copenhagen

item.title: Bi-weekly Hack n' Chill
item.description: Come and join us for some easy hacking like CTF and HTB. No experience hacking? Don't worry, just show up and everyone will help eachother.

item.title: Bi-weekly Hack n' Chill
item.description: Come and join us for some easy hacking like CTF and HTB. No experience hacking? Don't worry, just show up and everyone will help eachother.

item.title: Meet n' Greet
item.description:
We are ITUnderground, ITU's cybersecurity student organisation!
We would like to invite you to our Meet n' Greet on September 11th from 16:00 at room 2A50. Here we will briefly go over the events we'll be organising this semester, as well as have some beginner friendly CTF challenges ready for everyone to try out :) (Don't worry, you don't need any experience to try out those challenges, and there will be plenty of people around to help!) We will, of course, also have free snacks for all participants!
Hope to see you there, The ITUnderground team.

item.title: Patriot CTF
item.description: https://ctftime.org/event/2030\n\nWe meet up at ITU to play the CTF over the weekend. Stay tuned for more information in the discord server: https://discord.gg/NSYezU85nW

item.title: Semester planning
item.description: Planning what we'll do for this semester of ITUnderground. Feel free to show up!

item.title: Web 102
item.description: For this event we will explore more difficult parts of web challenges.

item.title: Pentest 101
item.description: We will look at more true to life hacking, hacking a "box" aka. a vulnerable server. We hope to hope to cover some useful tools for this and maybe even reverse shells.

item.title: Setup 101
item.description: We set up a Kali Linux enviornment and introduced some of the useful tools that come preinstalled. We also looked at how these tools could be used to obtain and crack passwords, as well as how to scan a website.

item.title: Zero to Hero
item.description: Web Hacking 101, Our first official Event. We introduced hacking and itunderground and covered how to get started with web challenges.
